Uses of Class
GameObjects.Point

  • Packages that use Point 
    Package Description
    GameObjects  

    • Uses of Point in GameObjects

      Methods in GameObjects that return Point 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Point Point.clone()
      A little bit of magic to make it easy to copy Points.
      Point[] Polygon.getPoints()
      Computes the actual location of this polygon in 2-D space by applying the current offset and rotation to the shape.
      Methods in GameObjects with parameters of type Point 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean Polygon.contains(Point point)
      Determine whether this polygon contains a given Point.
      Constructors in GameObjects with parameters of type Point 
      Constructor and Description
      Polygon(Point[] inShape)
      A convenience constructor which takes a sequence of points and puts the polygon at the origin with rotation 0.
      Polygon(Point[] inShape, Point inOffset, double inRotation)
      Creates internal representation of a polygon.
      Polygon(Point[] inShape, Point inOffset, double inRotation)
      Creates internal representation of a polygon.
      SimpleSpaceObject(Point[] inShape, Point inOffset, double inRotation)
      The only constructor, hooks up with Polygon constructor
      SimpleSpaceObject(Point[] inShape, Point inOffset, double inRotation)
      The only constructor, hooks up with Polygon constructor
